articles.author: Ida Emilie Steinmark
articles.title: The human genome needs updating. But how do we make it fair? - The Guardian
articles.description: Healthcare’s standard genome is mostly based on one American. As we enter the era of personalised medicine, this bias has drawbacks for much of the world’s population
articles.content: In June 2000, Bill Clinton, the then US president, stood smilingly next to the leaders of the Human Genome Project. In genetic terms, all human beings, regardless of race, are more than 99.9% the sam… [+10885 chars]

articles.author: Lisa Schlein
articles.title: Children Denied Same Access to Treatment for HIV/AIDS as Adults - Voice of America - VOA News
articles.description: UNAIDS says thousands of children are dying from HIV/AIDS because, unlike adults, they do not receive treatment for the deadly disease
articles.content:
GENEVA  The U.N.s main AIDS program says thousands of children are dying from HIV/AIDS because, unlike adults, they do not receive treatment for the deadly disease.
HIV/AIDS is no longer an automati… [+2261 chars]

articles.author: Juliana Kaplan
articles.title: Americans are going 'recession brunette' as economic woes force cutbacks on luxuries like hair-colouring - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: The 2008 recession created the ombré trend. Now, people are choosing to pay for essentials like eggs and gas instead of maintaining blonde hair.
articles.content:
For Jacque Garza, going brunette wasn't just a return to her roots — it was a financial necessity.
Garza, a 24-year-old natural brunette who for almost five years had a lighter balayage — or randomi… [+6784 chars]
